name: S&P Global
title: France Loses Ground in USA and China | Meininger's International
description:
The export of the French wine industry in 2025 was marked by profound structural changes, particularly in the two key markets of the USA and China.
In principle, the figures initially show that French wine exports were in decline during the first nine months of 2025.
Sparkling wine prices reduced A breakdown by category shows a mixed picture: sparkling wine exports, particularly Champagne, actually increased (+4.1%) to 148m liters.
The bulk wine category, which is less significant for French wine exports, lost 2.1% in volume.
In China, the volume of French wine exports in the first nine months of 2025 even fell by 36%.
text:
The export of the French wine industry in 2025 was marked by profound structural changes, particularly in the two key markets of the USA and China. This is the conclusion of an analysis by wine market analyst Del Rey AWM based on market data from S&P Global.

In principle, the figures initially show that French wine exports were in decline during the first nine months of 2025. Between January and September, exports decreased by 2.5% in value and 1.8% in volume, while average prices fell slightly to €8.71 per liter (-0.7%). In absolute figures, this means an export of 9.4m hectoliters of wine worth €8.2bn for this period.

Sparkling wine prices reduced

A breakdown by category shows a mixed picture: sparkling wine exports, particularly Champagne, actually increased (+4.1%) to 148m liters. However, this growth was accompanied by a reversal of the previous year's price increases: average prices fell by 6.2% to €19.58 per liter, which led to a revenue decrease of 2.3% to €2.9bn.

For bottled still wines, prices remained relatively stable at €7.68 per liter, but exports declined in both volume (–3.2%) and value (–2.9% to just over €5bn). The bulk wine category, which is less significant for French wine exports, lost 2.1% in volume. However, prices that were 8.5% higher led to a revenue increase of 6.2% (totaling €140m).

If the value losses of French wine exports are differentiated regionally, it becomes clear that a good third of the deficit was caused by the lack of demand for Bordeaux wines: €50.3m of the total €152.9m decline in revenue for bottled still wines is attributable to Bordeaux. Languedoc also suffered a sharp drop in value of €25.9m (–22.7%). Overall, AOP wines were significantly more affected by the decline than IGP wines: €140m of the decline in turnover for non-sparkling bottled wines was caused by wines with a protected designation of origin.

A look at different markets shows that the decline in sales to Asia and North America was partially offset by increased exports to Europe, Oceania, and Africa. Of course, these could not compensate for the losses, especially in the USA and China. Deliveries to the United States from January to September 2025 fell by 10.6% in value and 3.5% in volume. However, looking at the third quarter of last year in isolation, French wine exports to the USA collapsed by 39% in value and 15.1% in volume, as average prices fell by 28.5%, which Del Rey believes was intended to offset the higher tariffs.

In China, the volume of French wine exports in the first nine months of 2025 even fell by 36%. The fact that the value only decreased by 23.8% is—unlike the situation in the USA—thanks to a price increase of 19%. The export losses are not due to the customs situation, but to the structural decline in wine consumption in China—whereby the French premiumization strategy prevented worse.

As different as the respective problems are, according to Del Rey, in view of some of the main competitors such as Australia and Italy, "France suffered the largest decline among major suppliers." Incidentally, exports to South Korea, the United Arab Emirates, Singapore, and Luxembourg (–€48.5m alone) also fell. Better sales were achieved in Australia and New Zealand, but also in Spain, Germany, and the United Kingdom. As an outlook, Del Rey summarized: " For all producers, market diversification, product innovation, and a stronger focus on premium wines as well as fresher and new wine-based beverages appear essential to navigating this increasingly complex environment.” SP

name: Eli Lilly
title: Lilly buys inflammation biotech Ventyx for $1.2B in wake of Parkinson's, CV readouts
description:
Ventyx Biosciences has achieved its goal of securing Big Pharma commitment to its pipeline, with Eli Lilly swooping in to buy the inflammation biotech outright for $1.2 billion.
The San Diego-based company has made no secret of the fact that it was hoping to find additional pharma backing.
At the time, Ventyx CEO Raju Mohan, Ph.D., acknowledged that Sanofi’s right of first negotiation wouldn’t formally start until the second VTX3232 readout.
The price tag values Ventyx at around $1.2 billion, Lilly explained in a Jan. 7 release.
Beyond VTX3232, Ventyx has another NLRP3 inhibitor, dubbed VTX2735, in phase 2 studies for a type of heart inflammation called recurrent pericarditis.
text:
Ventyx Biosciences has achieved its goal of securing Big Pharma commitment to its pipeline, with Eli Lilly swooping in to buy the inflammation biotech outright for $1.2 billion.

The San Diego-based company has made no secret of the fact that it was hoping to find additional pharma backing. Sanofi had already secured the right to first negotiation for Ventyx’s Parkinson’s and cardiovascular disease candidate VTX3232 as part of a $27 million investment the French pharma made in the biotech in 2024.

A first readout from a phase 2 study of VTX3232 last June tied the NLRP3 inhibitor to drops in biomarkers of NLRP3 inhibition as well as improvements in Parkinson’s motor and non-motor symptoms.

At the time, Ventyx CEO Raju Mohan, Ph.D., acknowledged that Sanofi’s right of first negotiation wouldn’t formally start until the second VTX3232 readout. But the CEO gave a strong hint that the company didn’t want to wait that long to secure a Big Pharma partner.

“Sanofi is not restricted to waiting until the second readout," Mohan said at a Jefferies event in June 2025. “They or anybody else can act any time. We can't solicit other folks as part of [the right of first negotiation], but somebody can say, ‘Hey, look, we love your data.’”

It sounds like Lilly did just that. The U.S. pharma announced Wednesday that it was paying $14 per share of Ventyx—more than double the $7.50 the stock closed out at Monday. The price tag values Ventyx at around $1.2 billion, Lilly explained in a Jan. 7 release.

VTX3232 doesn’t only have potential for Parkinson’s patients. In October, Ventyx read out data from a separate phase 2 study demonstrating that the drug cut levels of a biomarker for stroke and other serious risks by almost 80% within a week. That trial looked at VTX3232 as a monotherapy as well as an add-on to Novo Nordisk’s blockbuster weight loss drug semaglutide.

Beyond VTX3232, Ventyx has another NLRP3 inhibitor, dubbed VTX2735, in phase 2 studies for a type of heart inflammation called recurrent pericarditis. There are also two inflammatory bowel disease drugs in phase 2 development—an S1P1R modulator called tamuzimod and a TYK2 inhibitor called VTX958.

Mohan described Lilly as an “ideal strategic partner,” pointing to the pharma’s “unparalleled resources, a passion for innovative oral drugs and a commitment to advance novel therapies.”

“Our portfolio of class-leading NLRP3 inhibitors modulate residual and chronic inflammation that is now recognized as a major risk factor in a host of neuroinflammatory, cardiometabolic and cardiovascular diseases,” Mohan added.

Explaining the rationale behind the deal, Lilly Chief Scientific and Product Officer Daniel Skovronsky, M.D., Ph.D., alluded to “increasing evidence that inflammation is a key driver of many chronic diseases.”

“Ventyx's clinical-stage pipeline addresses a critical need for better treatment options across diseases mediated by chronic inflammation and further strengthens our ability to deliver meaningful advances for patients living with challenging diseases across focus areas of cardiometabolic health, neurodegeneration and autoimmunity,” Skovronsky added.

William Blair analysts said yesterday’s deal “demonstrates clear interest from Big Pharma in the NLRP3 inhibitor class to address a broad range of neuroinflammatory, cardiometabolic, and cardiovascular diseases.”

In a Jan. 8 note, the analysts pointed out that other biopharmas are working in the NLRP3 space, name-checking the likes of Novartis, Neumora, Neurocrine Biosciences, BioAge, NodThera and Monte Rosa Therapeutics.

“NLRP3 in the [central nervous system] also represents an intriguing target for obesity and several preclinical studies across NLRP3 inhibitors suggest obesity efficacy in diet-induced-obesity models,” the analysts added. “However, not all NLRP3 inhibitors are CNS-penetrant.”

name: Philips
title: Philips Hue SpatialAware will make your smart lighting look way more natural - The Ambient
description:
Philips Hue has recently unveiled SpatialAware, a clever new feature that makes lighting scenes feel far more natural.
You see, instead of randomly assigning colours to bulbs, SpatialAware uses your phone’s camera to scan the room and map each light’s position.
Smarter scenes, smoother moods Lighting scenes have always been a highlight of the Hue app, offering quick ways to set a mood or transform a space.
SpatialAware fixes this by tailoring palettes to the actual layout of your lights, creating a sense of harmony across the room.
Bridge Pro gets its moment SpatialAware requires the Hue Bridge Pro, which launched last year.
text:
Philips Hue has recently unveiled SpatialAware, a clever new feature that makes lighting scenes feel far more natural.

You see, instead of randomly assigning colours to bulbs, SpatialAware uses your phone’s camera to scan the room and map each light’s position. The system then applies colours in a way that mirrors real-world effects, such as a sunset glowing warmly on one side of the room while the opposite side fades into darker tones.

Smarter scenes, smoother moods

Lighting scenes have always been a highlight of the Hue app, offering quick ways to set a mood or transform a space. The problem was that colours often felt scattered, with no sense of flow between bulbs. That mismatch could break the illusion, leaving rooms looking more chaotic than calming.

SpatialAware fixes this by tailoring palettes to the actual layout of your lights, creating a sense of harmony across the room.

The difference is striking: instead of random splashes of colour, you get gradients that feel intentional and immersive.

Nature‑inspired scenes such as “Savannah Sunset” or “Lake Mist” show off the feature best, with ceiling lights glowing like open skies while floor lamps settle into deeper tones that ground the space. The result is a more cohesive atmosphere that feels closer to how light behaves in the real world, making everyday moments at home more inviting.

Bridge Pro gets its moment

SpatialAware requires the Hue Bridge Pro, which launched last year. The latest update allows users to consolidate multiple bridges into one, supporting up to 150 lights and 50 accessories. That’s a big win for households already juggling several hubs.

AI assistant and Apple Home integration

Philips Hue’s AI assistant is also stepping up. It now creates automations based on natural requests, such as setting wake-up routines with exceptions. Language support continues to expand beyond English to include Dutch, German, and Spanish.

Meanwhile, Apple Home users will soon enjoy seamless integration with Hue Secure cameras, video doorbells, and sensors.

On the other hand, features like live streaming in picture-in-picture on Apple TV and real-time alerts in the Apple Home app are on the way.

name: Adobe
title: Holiday season e-commerce sales hit $258 billion: Adobe - Retail Brew
description:
Shoppers spent a record $257.8 billion online during the holiday season this year, a 6.8% year over year jump, according to Adobe Analytics.
The shopping season, which spans November 1 through December 31, saw 25 days when spending hit $4 billion, besting 2024’s 18 days.
Use of buy now, pay later methods also peaked this year, up 9.8% to $20 billion, posting the largest-ever spend day on Cyber Monday.
Online Cyber Week spend rose 7.7% YoY to $44.2 billion online.
Accounting for inflation, several analysts predicted holiday season sales volumes would likely see little growth.
text:
Shoppers spent a record $257.8 billion online during the holiday season this year, a 6.8% year over year jump, according to Adobe Analytics.

The shopping season, which spans November 1 through December 31, saw 25 days when spending hit $4 billion, besting 2024’s 18 days. Use of buy now, pay later methods also peaked this year, up 9.8% to $20 billion, posting the largest-ever spend day on Cyber Monday.

Online Cyber Week spend rose 7.7% YoY to $44.2 billion online. While Cyber Monday proved to be the biggest e-commerce day of the year, bringing in $14.25 billion in spend (up 7.1%), Black Friday’s growth actually outpaced Cyber Monday, with online spend jumping 9.1% to $11.8 billion.

Electronics were the top category, up 8.2% YoY to $59.8 billion, followed by apparel and furniture. Cosmetics got a 9.3% bump to $8.4 billion, while grocery spend increased 10.2% to $23.7 billion. Top sellers included video games, refrigerators and freezers, washers and dryers, and headphones and speakers.

Consumers shopped on their phones even more this season, with smartphone transactions accounting for 56.4% of online spend, compared to 54.5% in 2024. Mobile shopping peaked on Christmas Day, followed by Thanksgiving.

Discounts were, of course, a draw for consumers, particularly within electronics (the top discounts reached ~31% off), toys, apparel, TVs, computers, sporting goods, appliances, and furniture. Many consumers opted to use the season to purchase higher-ticket items, with units sold rising 20% versus the rest of the year, with the top category—electronics—up 56%.

Adobe also found that generative AI traffic to retail sites jumped 693.4% during the holiday season, though it noted the number of consumers using these tools was “modest.”

Zoom out: NRF predicted in November consumers would surpass $1 trillion, with growth between 3.7% and 4.2%, in overall holiday spending in 2025, but has yet to release final figures for the season. According to Mastercard SpendingPulse data, spending jumped 3.9% YoY between November 1 and December 21 across channels, while Visa reported a 4.2% increase in spend over the seven weeks starting November 1. Accounting for inflation, several analysts predicted holiday season sales volumes would likely see little growth.

Census Bureau retail sales numbers continued to be delayed due to last year’s government shutdown, with November’s data set to be published next week.

name: Instacart
title: 5 Crucial 2026 Retail Trends - Drug Store News
description:
Some emerging retail trends, especially in technology, will become mainstream.
AI Will Drive Customer and Employee Engagement AI is quickly moving from promise to reality at retail.
In another example, Walgreens has conducted what it calls the longest commitment to clinical research for a U.S. retail pharmacy, citing three years of leading a community-based research effort to improve patient access.
Store Development to Pursue Unique Approaches In some years store development trends have been relatively uniform across retail.
We can all benefit by staying focused on how these and other key trends unfold.
text:
Welcome to 2026. Drug store and grocery retailers will have major opportunities to make progress on strategies in areas such as artificial intelligence, pricing, pharmacy and loyalty.

Some emerging retail trends, especially in technology, will become mainstream. Other trends will represent unique, strategic opportunities.

Here are five key trends to watch.

1. Price/Value Messaging will be 24/7

After a holiday in which price and savings took center stage in retail messaging, from Walgreens to Target, companies will need to figure out how to incorporate this in an ongoing way. Price and value strategies will be crucial because approaching year-end Consumer Confidence remained weak and many shoppers were pulling back on discretionary spending and focusing more on price-value optimization, according to the 2026 Food and Beverage retail sector outlook published in early December by Circana, a Chicago-based market research firm.

2. AI Will Drive Customer and Employee Engagement

AI is quickly moving from promise to reality at retail. It is supporting shopper journeys in ways that guarantee it will become more ubiquitous this year and beyond. Walmart introduced new AI-powered tools for holiday 2025 geared to helping customers find deals, locate products and shop efficiently in-store and online. Kroger, meanwhile, enhanced its Instacart relationship by making available to customers Instacart’s AI assistant called Cart Assistant, for those shopping on the Kroger iOS mobile app.

3. Loyalty Rewards to Push Envelope

Retailers are ratcheting up strategies to reward their most loyal shoppers, by offering exclusive opportunities and launching contests, for example. Albertsons recently became the first major grocer to offer Uber One perks to free and paid loyalty members through extended free trials. Aldi, meanwhile, unveiled a contest to celebrate its most loyal fans by asking for feedback on why they should be considered a “Super Fan?” An exclusive group of 25 winners are offered a year’s worth of free groceries, an invitation to a members-only event and Aldi merch. As shoppers feel more love from retailers, they will likely want more TLC in 2026.

4. Pharmacy Embracing the Long View

Pharmacies are taking proactive approaches to bolster their futures by enhancing relevancy to customers and society. CVS Health has been conducting extensive research on how to advance community pharmacy. The retailer released 2025 Rx Report: Community Pharmacy Reimagined, which explores how community pharmacies are adapting to meet needs amid a changing landscape. In another example, Walgreens has conducted what it calls the longest commitment to clinical research for a U.S. retail pharmacy, citing three years of leading a community-based research effort to improve patient access.

5. Store Development to Pursue Unique Approaches

In some years store development trends have been relatively uniform across retail. That has been anything but the case lately. Retailers are taking highly individual approaches, a dynamic likely to continue. Last year Target opened the latest of its larger-format units, a nearly 150,000-square-foot location in South Riding, Va. Contrast that with a recent strategy from Whole Foods Market, which has been opening locations of its smaller-format store concept, called Whole Foods Market Daily Shop, with footprints of only a few thousand square feet each.

Why are these trends important? In my annual outlook piece a year ago, I mentioned it’s easy for retailers to get so involved in day-to-day activities that they miss key changes in the most important business developments. That point is truer than ever. We can all benefit by staying focused on how these and other key trends unfold.

name: Kraft Heinz
title: Kennedy Unveils Sweeping Overhaul Of U.S. Dietary Guidelines - Evrim Ağacı
description:
Americans are being urged to rethink the way they eat, as sweeping new federal dietary guidelines were unveiled on January 7, 2026 by Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and Secretary of Agriculture Brooke Rollins.
This historic reset—described by Kennedy as the most significant overhaul in decades—places real food, protein, and healthy fats squarely at the center of U.S. nutrition policy, while calling for a dramatic reduction in highly processed foods.
The visual overhaul is more than symbolic: it reflects a fundamental shift in federal thinking about what constitutes a healthy diet.
The new guidelines, updated every five years, are the backbone of federal food policy.
They influence what’s served in school cafeterias, on military bases, and in food aid programs for mothers and infants.
text:
Americans are being urged to rethink the way they eat, as sweeping new federal dietary guidelines were unveiled on January 7, 2026 by Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and Secretary of Agriculture Brooke Rollins. This historic reset—described by Kennedy as the most significant overhaul in decades—places real food, protein, and healthy fats squarely at the center of U.S. nutrition policy, while calling for a dramatic reduction in highly processed foods.

At a White House press conference, Kennedy declared, “These new guidelines will revolutionize our nation's food culture and make America healthier again.” Flanked by Rollins and other health officials, he introduced an updated food pyramid that visually prioritizes vegetables, proteins like red meat and eggs, cheese, and healthy fats such as olive oil and butter, with whole grains now forming the base of the pyramid. The visual overhaul is more than symbolic: it reflects a fundamental shift in federal thinking about what constitutes a healthy diet.

The new guidelines, updated every five years, are the backbone of federal food policy. They influence what’s served in school cafeterias, on military bases, and in food aid programs for mothers and infants. According to NPR, Kennedy and Rollins wrote that more than 70% of American adults are overweight or obese, attributing this crisis to a national diet “reliant on highly processed foods and coupled with a sedentary lifestyle.”

For the first time, the government is formally recommending that Americans cut down on ultra-processed foods. The guidelines explicitly warn against “packaged, prepared, ready-to-eat, or other foods that are salty or sweet,” as well as sugar-sweetened beverages like soda, fruit drinks, and energy drinks. Parents are advised to avoid all added sugars and artificial sweeteners for children under four years old, and the guidelines recommend no amount of added sugar for children under ten. “No amount of added sugars or non-nutritive sweeteners is part of a healthy diet,” the guidelines state, a stance that has drawn both praise and criticism from industry groups.

The new recommendations also call for Americans to “limit alcoholic beverages,” a departure from previous guidelines that specified daily limits for men and women. Dr. Mehmet Oz, administrator of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services, commented at the press conference, “There was never good data to support the previously recommended level of alcohol consumption.” He added, “In the best-case scenario, I don't think you should drink alcohol, but it does allow people an excuse to bond and socialize.”

One of the most controversial aspects of the new guidelines is the administration’s stance on saturated fats. Kennedy proclaimed, “We are ending the war on saturated fats,” arguing that protein and healthy fats “were wrongly discouraged in prior dietary guidelines.” The document encourages Americans to prioritize oils with essential fatty acids like olive oil, but also includes butter and beef tallow as acceptable options. Still, the guidelines maintain the long-held recommendation that saturated fat should not exceed 10% of daily calories—a point of contention for some nutrition experts.

“I'm very disappointed in the new pyramid that features red meat and saturated fat sources at the very top, as if that's something to prioritize. It does go against decades and decades of evidence and research,” said Christopher Gardner, a nutrition expert at Stanford University and a member of the Dietary Guidelines Advisory Committee, as reported by NPR. Both the American Heart Association (AHA) and the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics point to evidence linking excess saturated fat to heart disease. The AHA, while welcoming the new emphasis on fruits and vegetables and the call to limit highly processed foods and added sugars, continues to encourage Americans to prioritize plant-based proteins, seafood, and lean meats, and to limit high-fat animal products such as red meat, butter, lard, and tallow.

Despite the criticism, some experts see merit in the new approach. Dariush Mozaffarian, director of the Food is Medicine Institute at Tufts University, told NPR, “Both low-fat and whole-fat dairy versions of milk, cheese, and yogurt have been linked to lower cardiovascular risk. What's quite interesting is that the fat content doesn't seem to make a big difference.” He also praised the guidelines’ focus on reducing highly processed foods, saying, “Highly processed foods are clearly harmful for a range of diseases, so to have the U.S. government recommend that a wide class of foods be eaten less because of their processing is a big deal and I think a very positive move for public health.”

The guidelines emphasize a diet rich in “high-quality, nutrient-dense” proteins at every meal. These include red meat, poultry, seafood, eggs, and, for those who prefer plant-based options, beans, peas, lentils, legumes, nuts, seeds, and soy. According to the official HHS press release, the guidelines are intended to “improve Americans’ health by focusing on nutrition policy reform.”

Reactions from the food and beverage industry have been mixed. The Consumer Brands Association, representing major food companies like Coca-Cola and Kraft Heinz, expressed a willingness to work with the administration while noting that consumers still “seek a diverse selection of foods.” The American Beverage Association, however, criticized the recommendations to limit both added sugar and other sweeteners. “Americans deserve pragmatic advice they can use in daily life. Guidance that discourages sugar but dismisses safe, effective no sugar options is impractical and inherently contradictory,” spokesperson William Dermody said in a statement to Axios.

Meanwhile, advocacy groups and influencers aligned with Kennedy’s Make America Healthy Again (MAHA) agenda have welcomed the changes. Vani Hari, known as the “Food Babe,” called the new guidelines “a dream come true,” telling Axios, “We put our full support in for Secretary Kennedy because he told the truth for the first time about the American food system ... and he is following through with his promise.”

It’s worth noting that while the guidelines have shifted to embrace more protein and healthy fats, they continue to recommend moderation and balance—echoing a longstanding body of nutritional science. A 2024 panel of nutrition experts advised HHS and USDA to encourage Americans to eat less saturated fat and meat, and to be cautious about ultra-processed foods. The new guidelines blend these expert recommendations with Kennedy’s own priorities, resulting in a policy that is both a break from and a continuation of past approaches.

As the updated guidelines begin to shape federal food programs, school lunches, and the choices Americans make at the dinner table, the nation is set for a new chapter in its ongoing debate over nutrition. Whether these changes will lead to measurable improvements in public health remains to be seen, but one thing is clear: the conversation around what Americans eat has never been more front and center.

name: Delta Airlines
title: U.S. Carriers Warn Dublin Cap Could Cut Transatlantic Service | Aviation Week Network
description:
U.S. airlines have formally asked the U.S. Transportation Department (DOT) to intervene in a long-running dispute over passenger limits at Dublin Airport (DUB), arguing that the continued enforcement of a cap could restrict transatlantic service.
Aer Lingus currently serves 12 destinations in the U.S. A4A says the cap threatens to trigger the withdrawal of historic airport slots held by U.S. carriers at DUB, reducing or eliminating transatlantic services.
JetBlue, which launched its first flights to DUB in 2024, was previously denied requests to expand service because of capacity constraints tied to the passenger cap, according to the filing.
The group says this would violate provisions of the U.S.-EU agreement that guarantee airlines a “fair and equal opportunity to compete” and prohibit unilateral restrictions on traffic volumes.
The complaint asks the DOT to call a special meeting under the U.S.-EU air services agreement and to issue a show-cause order unless Ireland introduces emergency legislation to suspend or remove the cap by early February.
text:
U.S. airlines have formally asked the U.S. Transportation Department (DOT) to intervene in a long-running dispute over passenger limits at Dublin Airport (DUB), arguing that the continued enforcement of a cap could restrict transatlantic service.

In a complaint filed Jan. 5, trade group Airlines for America (A4A) accused Ireland and the European Union of violating the U.S.-EU Air Transport Agreement and U.S. law by maintaining a local planning condition that caps passenger volumes at Dublin Airport at 32 million annually—a limit first imposed in 2007 tied to the construction of Terminal 2.

The filing, submitted under the International Air Transportation Fair Competitive Practices Act, asks the DOT to take expedited action, including potentially curtailing Irish airlines’ access to the U.S. market if Ireland does not move to lift or suspend the cap. Aer Lingus currently serves 12 destinations in the U.S.

A4A says the cap threatens to trigger the withdrawal of historic airport slots held by U.S. carriers at DUB, reducing or eliminating transatlantic services. The group adds only an ongoing legal stay granted by Ireland’s High Court has so far prevented slot losses after airlines successfully challenged regulatory attempts to enforce seasonal limits tied to the cap.

Among the airlines cited in the complaint are Delta Air Lines, United Airlines and JetBlue Airways, which A4A says will be disproportionately affected if historic slots were withdrawn. JetBlue, which launched its first flights to DUB in 2024, was previously denied requests to expand service because of capacity constraints tied to the passenger cap, according to the filing.

The complaint outlines parallel legal proceedings in Ireland and at the Court of Justice of the European Union, where questions have been referred about whether the passenger cap complies with EU slot allocation rules. An advisory opinion from the court’s advocate general is due Feb. 12, with a final ruling expected later in 2026.

A4A argues that the EU court process does not address U.S. treaty rights and warns that an adverse ruling could allow Ireland to impose unilateral limits on air service. The group says this would violate provisions of the U.S.-EU agreement that guarantee airlines a “fair and equal opportunity to compete” and prohibit unilateral restrictions on traffic volumes.

Currently, DUB is exceeding the 32 million limit, handling around 36 million passengers in 2025, owing in part to High Court stays on enforcement.

The filing also details enforcement action launched by Fingal County Council, the local planning authority, against the airport operator for exceeding the cap. Airport operator daa has previously attempted to raise the limit to 36 million passengers.

Ireland’s government has publicly committed to removing the cap and has progressed draft legislation to increase or abolish the restriction, but no bill has yet become law. A4A says delays could force service reductions as early as the winter 2026-27 season if enforcement proceeds.

The complaint asks the DOT to call a special meeting under the U.S.-EU air services agreement and to issue a show-cause order unless Ireland introduces emergency legislation to suspend or remove the cap by early February.

text:
Investing.com - Piper Sandler is anticipating potential merger and acquisition activity in the medical device sector, following a pattern of major acquisitions announced during healthcare conferences in recent years.

The investment firm noted that after acquired Inari in 2025 and purchased Axonics in 2024, investors are questioning which companies might be acquisition targets in the upcoming conference.

Piper Sandler identified several medical technology areas that appear "in play" for potential transactions, including mechanical thrombectomy, neuromodulation, MIGS (minimally invasive glaucoma surgery), cardiac monitoring, and soft tissue robotics.

The firm specifically mentioned and Stryker as companies with strong balance sheets that have expressed readiness to deploy capital for acquisitions, with both potentially serving as buyers for assets in these segments. InvestingPro data confirms Medtronic’s financial strength, with $5.2 billion in free cash flow and liquid assets exceeding short-term obligations. Trading near its 52-week high at $100.09, Medtronic appears fairly valued according to InvestingPro’s Fair Value model and maintains a solid "GOOD" financial health score of 2.99.

Cardiac monitoring was highlighted as the sector most likely to see acquisition activity, with Piper Sandler noting "there are a couple of big players without exposure here," while predicting that even if immediate deals don’t materialize, 2026 will experience "strong deal flow" for both public and private assets. With a market cap of $128.2 billion and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.6, Medtronic has maintained dividend payments for an impressive 49 consecutive years. For investors tracking potential M&A moves, InvestingPro offers comprehensive Pro Research Reports on 1,400+ top stocks including Medtronic, with additional ProTips and financial metrics that provide deeper insights for smarter investment decisions.

In other recent news, Medtronic has announced significant developments across its operations. The company’s diabetes unit, MiniMed, has filed for an initial public offering with plans to list on the Nasdaq Global Select Market. This move is part of a broader strategy to separate the diabetes business through capital market transactions. In addition, a real-world analysis published in Diabetes Care highlighted the effectiveness of Medtronic’s MiniMed 780G system in maintaining glucose control, even when users missed mealtime insulin doses.

Meanwhile, William Blair has upgraded Medtronic’s stock rating from Market Perform to Outperform, citing the company’s promising product pipeline and anticipated organizational changes. This upgrade suggests potential growth as Medtronic enters 2026 with new product launches. On a different note, Piper Sandler has maintained a Neutral rating for Medtronic, following a survey on renal denervation procedure volumes. These recent developments provide a snapshot of Medtronic’s strategic initiatives and market positioning.

This article was generated with the support of AI and reviewed by an editor. For more information see our T&C.

name: L’Oréal
title: Pinterest pilots new show after CTV acquisition - MediaCat UK
description:
Pinterest is launching a connected TV show, giving credence to the prediction that more brands will seek to establish themselves as content creators in 2026.
The new show, called Bring My Pinterest to Life, follows three influencers (Drew Michael Scott, Caroline Vazzana and TayBeepBoop*) as they work with the platforms’ users on projects using a Pinterest board for inspiration.
While Pinterest videos were already available to watch on CTV as Pinterest+, this will be the first TV show made by the platform.
In December, Pinterest announced its acquisition of cost-per-outcome CTV ad platform TvScientific, although the deal is still under regulatory review and is not expected to be confirmed until later this year.
The trailer for Bring My Pinterest to Life was uploaded to YouTube on 5 Jan, and the show itself will be streaming on Roku from 23 March.
text:
Pinterest is launching a connected TV show, giving credence to the prediction that more brands will seek to establish themselves as content creators in 2026.

The new show, called Bring My Pinterest to Life, follows three influencers (Drew Michael Scott, Caroline Vazzana and TayBeepBoop*) as they work with the platforms’ users on projects using a Pinterest board for inspiration. Each 22-minute episode will include real pins and boards, which viewers can save, shop, and explore without clicking away from the show. Some of the brands that will be available to shop on the show have already been announced, including Wayfair and Eos.

While Pinterest videos were already available to watch on CTV as Pinterest+, this will be the first TV show made by the platform. Other brands have successfully made the leap into entertainment — such as Red Bull — but not many. And Pinterest faces unique challenges as a platform that hosts no original content.

But the move is not completely out of the blue. In December, Pinterest announced its acquisition of cost-per-outcome CTV ad platform TvScientific, although the deal is still under regulatory review and is not expected to be confirmed until later this year.

At the time of the purchase, a spokesperson for Pinterest commented: ‘TvScientific’s outcome-based CTV platform will be integrated directly into Pinterest’s performance products, including its automation and AI-powered advertising suite, Pinterest Performance+.’

Pinterest’s announcement described the format, with its integrated ads, as an ‘emotionally resonant, shoppable’ ‘full-funnel path’ for viewers. It mirrors other features added to Pinterest to capture the full consumer journey, such as the shoppable recipes rolled out last month and Where to Buy links for consumer packaged goods pinned on the platform.

The trailer for Bring My Pinterest to Life was uploaded to YouTube on 5 Jan, and the show itself will be streaming on Roku from 23 March. The trailer is unlisted, and at time of writing has been viewed slightly under 500 times — and three of those were by me.

Earlier this month, Media War and Peace writer Evan Shapiro predicted that this would be the year of brands converting from traditional influencer marketing to launching their own content channels. He highlighted recently-launched brand channels or production companies from Under Armour, Procter & Gamble and L’Oréal as examples of this trend coming at a time when ‘the creator economy’ is taking up more and more of people’s consumption hours and brands ‘must become creators themselves’ to compete for attention.

‘There may be influencers and creators on it, but the [brand’s channel] will become an influencer and a creator,’ he said.

*Real name Tay Nakamoto

name: Societe Generale
title: Casablanca Airport to Add New Terminal After Winning MAD 12.8 Billion from ONDA
authors: Donya Essassi, Amina Elghoubachi, Mohamed Boutakrint, Jihane Rahhou
description:
Morocco’s Airports Office (ONDA) has awarded the contract for the construction of the new terminal at Casablanca Mohammed V Airport to the all-Moroccan consortium Société Générale des Travaux du Maroc (SGTM) and Travaux Généraux de Construction de Casablanca (TGCC), for a total amount of MAD 12.8 billion.
The terminal will also be connected to the future Tangier–Marrakech high-speed rail line, currently under construction.
The project will mobilize national experience, create thousands of direct and indirect jobs, and provide a significant boost to Morocco’s construction and related services sectors.
The project was awarded following a competitive tender process completed in just 18 months, covering infrastructure planning, architectural, and technical studies.
In a statement, ONDA described the project as “the largest airport construction site ever undertaken in Morocco,” representing a major milestone in the development of the Kingdom’s main airport and reflecting the ambition to strengthen Casablanca’s role as a regional and international hub.
text:
Morocco’s Airports Office (ONDA) has awarded the contract for the construction of the new terminal at Casablanca Mohammed V Airport to the all-Moroccan consortium Société Générale des Travaux du Maroc (SGTM) and Travaux Généraux de Construction de Casablanca (TGCC), for a total amount of MAD 12.8 billion.

The new terminal will span 600,000 square meters and is designed to handle 20 million passengers per year in its initial phase, with the capacity to be expanded to 30 million.

The space will incorporate exemplary architectural design, passenger flow efficiency, environmental performance, and smart traffic management. The terminal will also be connected to the future Tangier–Marrakech high-speed rail line, currently under construction.

The facility will support Morocco’s carrier Royal Air Maroc’s expansion strategy and accommodate up to 45 aircraft at contact stands, to improve passenger flow, Morocco’s Press Agency (MAP) reported.

Construction is expected to take 40 months, with completion scheduled for mid-2029. The project will mobilize national experience, create thousands of direct and indirect jobs, and provide a significant boost to Morocco’s construction and related services sectors.

The project was awarded following a competitive tender process completed in just 18 months, covering infrastructure planning, architectural, and technical studies. The contract was finalized eight months after the initial call launch in April 2025.

In a statement, ONDA described the project as “the largest airport construction site ever undertaken in Morocco,” representing a major milestone in the development of the Kingdom’s main airport and reflecting the ambition to strengthen Casablanca’s role as a regional and international hub.

name: Nvidia
title: Piper Sandler reiterates Nvidia stock rating, names it top data center pick - Investing.com
description:
Investing.com - Piper Sandler has reiterated an Overweight rating and $225.00 price target on , naming it the firm’s top large-cap data center pick for the calendar year.
This aligns with the broader analyst sentiment, as Nvidia currently holds a strong buy consensus recommendation with targets ranging from $140 to $352.
Piper Sandler also highlighted Nvidia’s favorable valuation at approximately 24.5 times price-to-earnings ratio on a next-twelve-months basis as another factor supporting its bullish stance.

Additionally, Nvidia’s new Rubin chip has been introduced, showcasing its ability to operate at higher temperatures compared to traditional data center processors.
text:
Investing.com - Piper Sandler has reiterated an Overweight rating and $225.00 price target on , naming it the firm’s top large-cap data center pick for the calendar year. This aligns with the broader analyst sentiment, as Nvidia currently holds a strong buy consensus recommendation with targets ranging from $140 to $352.

The research firm cited Nvidia’s sustained technological leadership, growing strategic partnerships, and full software stack as key reasons for its positive outlook on the stock. These strengths have helped Nvidia achieve remarkable 65.22% revenue growth over the last twelve months, cementing its position as a prominent player in the semiconductor industry.

Piper Sandler also highlighted Nvidia’s favorable valuation at approximately 24.5 times price-to-earnings ratio on a next-twelve-months basis as another factor supporting its bullish stance. While InvestingPro data shows a current P/E of 46.77, the stock’s PEG ratio of 0.78 suggests it’s trading at a reasonable valuation relative to its growth rate. According to InvestingPro’s Fair Value assessment, Nvidia appears slightly undervalued at current levels.

The firm expressed particular enthusiasm about the expected performance gains from Nvidia’s Vera Rubin rack, which is anticipated to generate revenues in the second half of 2026.

In the same research note, Piper Sandler mentioned Microchip Technology (NASDAQ:MCHP) as likely to benefit most from a recovery in the analog space, and identified Impinj (NASDAQ:PI) as its top small-cap idea with multiple potential catalysts ahead.

In other recent news, Nvidia has maintained its strong position in the market with reaffirmations from major financial analysts. Stifel has reiterated its Buy rating for Nvidia, setting a price target of $250, citing a positive outlook on Nvidia’s sales in China and highlighting the potential impact of H200-based sales on earnings. Similarly, Citi has also reiterated a Buy rating, maintaining a slightly higher price target of $270. In a strategic move, Nvidia is now requiring Chinese clients to make full upfront payments for H200 AI chips, with no options for cancellations or refunds, underscoring the demand and value of these chips.

Additionally, Nvidia’s new Rubin chip has been introduced, showcasing its ability to operate at higher temperatures compared to traditional data center processors. This development could signify a shift in cooling norms within the industry. However, the announcement has led to a 5% drop in Munters shares, as the new chip challenges existing cooling technologies. These recent developments highlight Nvidia’s ongoing influence and strategic maneuvers in the tech industry.

name: Adobe
title: Authenticity, emotion, human connection top Adobe's 2026 creative trends - BusinessDay
description:
Adobe’s 2026 creative trends have focused on authenticity, emotion, and human connection in its published annual predictions for creative trends.
The annual creative trend forecast for 2026 focuses firmly on what AI cannot do, such as human emotion, authenticity, and cultural nuance, as key areas where creatives can stand out in an increasingly automated world.
Adobe’s forecast reflects broader industry conversations about AI’s role in creativity and not as a stand-alone creator but as a partner in amplifying human imagination and emotion.
By blending AI with human creativity, Adobe acknowledges that AI remains a defining force in the creative landscape, but its 2026 predictions balance AI-enabled innovation with distinctly human qualities.
This trend stresses that photographers and creatives should focus on emotional impact and human connection in their work.
text:
Adobe’s 2026 creative trends have focused on authenticity, emotion, and human connection in its published annual predictions for creative trends.

The annual creative trend forecast for 2026 focuses firmly on what AI cannot do, such as human emotion, authenticity, and cultural nuance, as key areas where creatives can stand out in an increasingly automated world.

Adobe’s forecast reflects broader industry conversations about AI’s role in creativity and not as a stand-alone creator but as a partner in amplifying human imagination and emotion.

By blending AI with human creativity, Adobe acknowledges that AI remains a defining force in the creative landscape, but its 2026 predictions balance AI-enabled innovation with distinctly human qualities.

Read also: AI in Creative Industries: Transforming How We Create, Design, and Automate Marketing

Two of the four major trends the company highlights lean into emotional resonance and genuine experience, which suggests a shift from purely technical capabilities to deeper human storytelling.

One of the trends is termed ‘Connectioneering,’ which explains visuals that stir emotions and spark connection.

According to Adobe, audiences are increasingly drawn to work that reflects shared human experiences and conveys genuine feelings, which is something AI, at its core, cannot truly feel or originate.

This trend stresses that photographers and creatives should focus on emotional impact and human connection in their work.

Authentic cultural storytelling was also a trend termed as local flavors, which is major as it centres on authentic regional and cultural expression. Adobe reports growing demand from brands and enterprises for content that genuinely reflects local identity and experiences.

Read also: Verve surpasses 100m cards, unveils new partnerships with Adobe, Glovo

This move taps into a broader creative desire for work grounded in place, culture, and lived experience, countering generic, AI-generated imagery.

While AI remains a tool in the creative toolkit, for instance, in generating surreal visuals or new forms of expression, Adobe’s forecast suggests the true value lies in how creators use AI to support, not replace, their vision.

Adobe emphasises that embracing authentic storytelling alongside innovation is where the biggest opportunities lie for creatives in 2026.

name: OpenAI
title: OpenAI launches dedicated health feature for ChatGPT - Silicon Republic
description:
More than 230m people globally ask health and wellness-related questions on ChatGPT every week, OpenAI said.
OpenAI is releasing ChatGPT Health, a dedicated service within the AI chatbot for health-related queries.
The new service is marketed as the secure and a ‘one stop shop’ way of asking ChatGPT personal health questions.
OpenAI claimed that ChatGPT Health tries to mitigate these issues.
The company stated that ChatGPT Health is built with purpose-built encryption and isolation to keep health conversations “protected and compartmentalised”.
text:
More than 230m people globally ask health and wellness-related questions on ChatGPT every week, OpenAI said.

OpenAI is releasing ChatGPT Health, a dedicated service within the AI chatbot for health-related queries.

The new service is marketed as the secure and a ‘one stop shop’ way of asking ChatGPT personal health questions.

Users can connect their medical records and wellness apps such as Apple Health and MyFitnessPal to ChatGPT, allowing the bot access to analyse the data and output informed responses, according to OpenAI. This can include understanding test results, preparing for appointments, and advice on diet and workouts.

The AI giant added that the service is designed to “support, not replace” medical care.

According to OpenAI, more than 230m people globally ask health and wellness-related questions on ChatGPT every week. However, these are not entirely private.

Speaking in a podcast last year, CEO Sam Altman said that ChatGPT does not offer doctor-patient confidentiality the same way a trained human professional would. “People talk about the most personal shit in their lives to ChatGPT.”

This, he said, could lead to privacy concerns in the case of a lawsuit, because OpenAI would be legally required to produce those conversations. Plus, if left to its default settings, ChatGPT also takes user inputs and content to train its models.

OpenAI claimed that ChatGPT Health tries to mitigate these issues.

The company stated that ChatGPT Health is built with purpose-built encryption and isolation to keep health conversations “protected and compartmentalised”.

Conversations from the service are also not used to train OpenAI’s foundation models, the company said. And although ChatGPT might take data from non-Health chats, OpenAI claims that data shared to Health will not flow back out the other way.

OpenAI added that users can view or delete Health memories at any time within Health or the ‘Personalisation’ section of the service’s settings.

OpenAI said it has worked for more than two years with more than 260 physicians across the world to develop the service. The company claimed that the chatbot has been evaluated against clinical standards set by an assessment framework OpenAI has created specifically for examining health-related outputs.

Interested users outside the EEA, Switzerland and the UK can sign up for the waitlist to join ChatGPT Health, which will run with a small cohort of users to refine the experience. The company plans to expand access and make the service available to users across the web and iOS in the coming weeks, it said.

With hundreds of millions using AI chatbots, information shared to ChatGPT, Anthropic’s Claude, Google’s Gemini and others are not just valuable to the companies providing the services. A security firm recently uncovered a VPN service which captured conversations users were having on AI platforms, selling it for marketing purposes.

description:

Key players in the Asia Pacific cryogenic equipment market focus on product launches and partnerships, among other strategies, to reinforce their technology leadership and improve their business.
Market Ranking The Asia Pacific cryogenic equipment market is highly competitive, with key players accounting for around 40–48%.
Air Liquide mainly focuses on enhancing its presence globally by entering into collaborations and expansions to strengthen their presence globally.
Related Reports: Asia Pacific Cryogenic Equipment Market by Equipment (Tanks, Valves, Vaporizers, Pumps), Cryogen (Nitrogen, Argon, Oxygen, LNG, Hydrogen), End-use Industry (Energy & Power, Chemical, Metallurgy, Transportation), System Type, Application - Forecast to 2030
text:
The Asia Pacific cryogenic equipment market is projected to grow from USD 5.32 billion in 2025 to USD 8.72 billion by 2030, at a CAGR of 10.4% during the forecast period (2025–2030). Growing LNG and hydrogen infrastructure, with nations developing import terminals and clean-energy hubs, increased need for storage, and subsequent demand for pumps and vaporizers, drive the regional market. The boom of healthcare and biotech is putting strain on the cryogenic systems to conserve the medical gases and biological samples. Objectives of industrialization and energy transition drive the use of cryogenic technologies in the manufacturing, metallurgy, and power industries. Additionally, the government's clean-energy programs, smart/IoT solutions, and aerospace innovations also contribute to the market development and innovation.

Major players include Air Liquide (France), Linde plc (Ireland), Chart Industries (US), Cryofab Inc. (US), and Taylor-Wharton (US). Key players in the Asia Pacific cryogenic equipment market focus on product launches and partnerships, among other strategies, to reinforce their technology leadership and improve their business. For instance, in February 2023, Linde plc signed an agreement with BASF, one of the world's largest chemical companies, for the engineering, procurement, and construction of a synthesis gas plant in Zhanjiang, China.

To know about the assumptions considered for the study download the pdf brochure

Air Liquide (France)

Air Liquide is a leader in the area of deep cryogenic technology development, high investment in R&D, and also advanced process control systems aimed at clean energy and industrial gas usage. The company focuses on strategic partnerships and a vast portfolio of patents that propel custom, high-performance solutions and commitment to sustainability and long-term technological leadership that builds upon customer trust and differentiation when working on complex projects.

Chart Industries (US)

Chart Industries focuses on specialized engineering excellence and built-in cryogenics in LNG, hydrogen, and industrial gases, backed by an end-to-end product scope and acquisitions that lead to technical advancement. The company emphasizes highly efficient and customer-specific solutions. Its collaborations with the partners in developing energy infrastructure allow it to respond innovatively and take advantage of the competitive edge in the dynamic Asia Pacific projects.

Market Ranking

The Asia Pacific cryogenic equipment market is highly competitive, with key players accounting for around 40–48%. Air Liquide, Linde plc, Chart Industries, Cryofab Inc., and Taylor-Wharton stay ahead by offering a range of cryogenic equipment for the transportation, chemical, and electronics industries. Air Liquide mainly focuses on enhancing its presence globally by entering into collaborations and expansions to strengthen their presence globally. For instance, Air Liquide expanded in the US and India by opening new manufacturing facilities in both countries. In the US, the company inaugurated a new biomethane production facility. In India, the company has invested in an air separation unit to support small and medium-sized customers of packaged gases and liquids. The remaining 52–60% of the market is shared among other regional and emerging markets, contributing to extensive fragmentation and offering opportunities for smaller players to establish a footprint.

title: Uber Renews Global Maps Deal With TomTom: Growth Thesis Strengthening? - Nasdaq
description:
In a customer-friendly move, Uber Technologies UBER has renewed its partnership with navigation company TomTom.
Following the agreement, Uber will integrate TomTom’s maps, Maps APIs and live services across its global platform.
6-Month Price Comparison Image Source: Zacks Investment Research From a valuation standpoint, UBER trades at a 12-month forward price-to-sales of 2.94X.
Image Source: Zacks Investment Research UBER's Zacks Rank UBER currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).
Zacks Investment Research The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
text:
In a customer-friendly move, Uber Technologies UBER has renewed its partnership with navigation company TomTom. Following the agreement, Uber will integrate TomTom’s maps, Maps APIs and live services across its global platform. The partnership will enhance Uber’s routing, fare calculations, and pick-up and drop-off accuracy, particularly in complex locations such as airports, transit hubs and stadiums. This is expected to reduce travel time and uncertainty while improving reliability and operational efficiency for both drivers and riders.

TomTom’s mapping platform continuously aggregates data from thousands of sources and processes billions of data points to keep maps current. The technological collaboration establishes a feedback loop in which anonymized real-world data from Uber trips is incorporated into TomTom’s maps, improving updates on roads, turn restrictions and closures.

Uber and TomTom are building on their long-standing partnership (the initial deal was inked in 2015) and actively exploring new opportunities to introduce additional location-based tools that will further expand the capabilities of the former’s platform and enhance the overall user experience.

We remind investors that way back in 2015, Uber had looked to buy Nokia's NOK mapping division, HERE, for around $3 billion. The aim of buying Nokia’s mapping division was to gain control of mapping technology for its core services and future self-driving cars. However, Uber ultimately lost its bid to buy Nokia’s mapping service, which was sold to a consortium of German automakers.

Following the failure to buy Nokia’s HERE, Uber partnered with TomTom and also acquired Microsoft's MSFT Bing Maps imagery division, bringing in talent and street-level data for autonomous vehicle development. Through this deal, Uber absorbed data-collection engineers from Microsoft to bolster its mapping work. Roughly 100 Microsoft employees joined Uber following the deal.

UBER’s Price Performance, Valuation and Estimates

Shares of UBER have lost 10.8% in the past six months against the Zacks Internet-Services industry’s 69.6% growth in the same timeframe.

6-Month Price Comparison

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

From a valuation standpoint, UBER trades at a 12-month forward price-to-sales of 2.94X. UBER is inexpensive compared with its industry, having a Value Score of D.

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The Zacks Consensus Estimate for UBER’s fourth-quarter 2025, full-year 2025 and 2026 earnings have moved north over the past 60 days.

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

UBER's Zacks Rank

UBER currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here.

Quantum Computing is the next technological revolution, and it could be even more advanced than AI.

While some believed the technology was years away, it is already present and moving fast. Large hyperscalers, such as Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Oracle, and even Meta and Tesla, are scrambling to integrate quantum computing into their infrastructure.

title: SEI appoints Jeff Benfield as chief product officer - Investing.com
description:
OAKS, Pa. - Financial technology provider SEI (NASDAQ:SEIC) announced Thursday the appointment of Jeff Benfield as Chief Product Officer, creating a new leadership role to oversee the company’s enterprise product strategy and development.
Benfield, who previously served as Head of Platform Strategy and Operations for SEI’s Asset Management business, will report to Chief Technology Officer Zach Womack.
Benfield first joined SEI in 2014 in a strategy and product management role for the company’s global Private Banking business.
Raymond James also raised its price target for SEI Investments from $115.00 to $117.00, maintaining an Outperform rating.
These recent developments reflect SEI Investments’ ongoing efforts to enhance shareholder value and capitalize on growth opportunities.
text:
OAKS, Pa. - Financial technology provider SEI (NASDAQ:SEIC) announced Thursday the appointment of Jeff Benfield as Chief Product Officer, creating a new leadership role to oversee the company’s enterprise product strategy and development. The appointment comes as SEI continues to demonstrate strong financial health, with InvestingPro data showing the company is currently trading at a low P/E ratio of 16.12 relative to its near-term earnings growth potential.

Benfield, who previously served as Head of Platform Strategy and Operations for SEI’s Asset Management business, will report to Chief Technology Officer Zach Womack. In his new position, Benfield will be responsible for managing the full product lifecycle from ideation to optimization.

"Jeff’s proven ability to drive product innovation and his deep understanding of the financial technology landscape will help us deliver solutions that not only meet but anticipate our clients’ needs," Womack said in the press release.

Benfield first joined SEI in 2014 in a strategy and product management role for the company’s global Private Banking business. He brings over 18 years of financial services industry experience, having previously held positions at Vanguard, BNY Mellon’s Pershing/Albridge, and Axa Advisors.

His educational background includes a bachelor’s degree from Lehigh University, an MBA from Texas A&M University, and a Certificate in Financial Planning from Wake Forest University. He is also a Certified Financial Planner.

SEI manages, advises, or administers approximately $1.8 trillion in assets as of September 30, 2025, according to the company statement. The firm provides financial technology, operations, and asset management services within the financial services industry. With a market capitalization of $10.78 billion, SEI has maintained dividend payments for 38 consecutive years and raised its dividend for 12 consecutive years, according to InvestingPro data. The company’s management has been aggressively buying back shares, demonstrating confidence in its business model. SEI’s strong liquidity position is evident as its liquid assets exceed short-term obligations, with a current ratio of 5.73.For investors seeking deeper insights into SEI’s financial health and growth prospects, InvestingPro offers a comprehensive Pro Research Report with additional ProTips and metrics that transform complex Wall Street data into actionable intelligence.

In other recent news, SEI Investments announced a 6.1% increase in its semi-annual dividend, raising it to $0.52 per share, payable on January 12, 2026. The company has also completed the first stage of its strategic investment in Stratos Wealth Holdings, acquiring approximately 57.5% equity for $441 million. In addition, SEI Investments has expanded its stock repurchase program by $650 million, bringing the total authorization to approximately $773.2 million. Piper Sandler upgraded SEI Investments’ stock from Neutral to Overweight, citing a 40% year-over-year increase in sales and a $144 million gain in new business. Raymond James also raised its price target for SEI Investments from $115.00 to $117.00, maintaining an Outperform rating. These recent developments reflect SEI Investments’ ongoing efforts to enhance shareholder value and capitalize on growth opportunities.

name: Kraft Heinz
outlet: Regulatory Shift in Washington Puts Kraft Heinz Strategy Under Scrutiny
title: Regulatory Shift in Washington Puts Kraft Heinz Strategy Under Scrutiny - AD HOC NEWS
description:
Kraft Heinz US5007541064 The tenure of Kraft Heinz's new Chief Executive, Steve Cahillane, begins with a significant and unexpected hurdle.
Kraft Heinz shares are currently trading at $23.01, hovering near a 52-week low.
Policy Reversal Targets Core Product Lines The pressure stems from a pronounced reversal in U.S. health policy under Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s leadership.
Or is it worth buying Kraft Heinz?
Planned Corporate Split Faces New Hurdles The regulatory development arrives at a critical strategic juncture for Kraft Heinz.
text:
Kraft Heinz US5007541064

The tenure of Kraft Heinz's new Chief Executive, Steve Cahillane, begins with a significant and unexpected hurdle. A sudden shift in U.S. federal dietary guidelines, framed as a renewed offensive against sugar, poses a direct threat to the company's core business and complicates a major corporate restructuring plan already in motion.

Investor sentiment turned cautious following the policy announcement from Washington. Kraft Heinz shares are currently trading at $23.01, hovering near a 52-week low. This nervousness appears sector-wide, with peers like General Mills and Conagra Brands also recording losses. This pattern suggests a potential rotation away from traditional packaged food stocks as the market digests the long-term implications of the new health agenda.

Policy Reversal Targets Core Product Lines

The pressure stems from a pronounced reversal in U.S. health policy under Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s leadership. The administration's updated guidelines now prioritize proteins and healthy fats, explicitly targeting processed foods and added sugars. A specific recommendation to limit consumption to a maximum of 10 grams of sugar per meal strikes at the heart of Kraft Heinz's product portfolio.

This new framework places the company's "North American Grocery" segment—home to iconic brands such as Lunchables, Oscar Mayer, and Kool-Aid—under immediate scrutiny. Market observers are not merely flagging a reputational risk but are warning of a tangible danger to a high-volume, core revenue stream.

Should investors sell immediately? Or is it worth buying Kraft Heinz?

Planned Corporate Split Faces New Hurdles

The regulatory development arrives at a critical strategic juncture for Kraft Heinz. The company is planning to separate into two independent publicly traded entities in the second half of 2026: a growth-focused "Global Taste Elevation" business (encompassing brands like Heinz and Philadelphia) and the aforementioned "North American Grocery" division.

These new guidelines substantially complicate the valuation of the planned grocery spin-off. Should government-backed programs, including public school meal initiatives, align their purchasing with the stricter sugar and processing limits, the segment could face structural revenue declines. This risk may render the spin-off considerably less attractive to potential investors and could force management to reconsider the capital structure of the new entity.

All eyes are now on the upcoming fourth-quarter earnings report in February. Analysts anticipate that CEO Cahillane will provide his first detailed commentary on the impact of the evolving political landscape during this update. From a technical analysis perspective, the situation remains tense; a breach of the support level at $22.50 could trigger further downward momentum for the stock.

name: Eli Lilly
title: Lilly announces acquisition of Ventyx Biosciences for around $1.2bn - PMLiVE
description:
Eli Lilly has announced that it has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Ventyx Biosciences, a biopharmaceutical company developing oral therapies for inflammation-mediated diseases.
Multiple drugs discovered by Ventyx are currently in phase 2 development for recurrent pericarditis, Parkinson’s disease and inflammatory bowel disease.
Daniel M Skovronsky, chief scientific and product officer at Lilly and president of Lilly Research Laboratories, said: “There is increasing evidence that inflammation is a key driver of many chronic diseases.
Under the agreement, Lilly will acquire all outstanding shares in Ventyx, making up around 10% of Ventyx’ outstanding stock.
The acquisition of Ventyx builds on Lilly’s existing research and development programmes in autoimmune and inflammatory disease.
text:
Eli Lilly has announced that it has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Ventyx Biosciences, a biopharmaceutical company developing oral therapies for inflammation-mediated diseases.

Ventyx’ clinical-stage programmes are designed to target vital immune pathways, aiming to achieve greater safety and efficacy than current treatments. The company’s pipeline of small molecule therapies are aimed at treating inflammation in diseases with high unmet medical need, including cardiometabolic, neurodegenerative and inflammatory disorders.

Ventyx’ portfolio includes NLRP3 inhibitors that act to block inflammation. Multiple drugs discovered by Ventyx are currently in phase 2 development for recurrent pericarditis, Parkinson’s disease and inflammatory bowel disease.

Daniel M Skovronsky, chief scientific and product officer at Lilly and president of Lilly Research Laboratories, said: “There is increasing evidence that inflammation is a key driver of many chronic diseases. Ventyx’ clinical-stage pipeline addresses a critical need for better treatment options across diseases mediated by chronic inflammation.”

Raju Mohan, CEO of Ventyx, added: “Our portfolio of NLRP3 inhibitors modulate residual and chronic inflammation that is now recognised as a major risk factor in a host of neuroinflammatory, cardiometabolic and cardiovascular diseases. We believe that Lilly is an ideal strategic partner…to advance novel therapies that fill a vast unmet need for patients suffering from these debilitating diseases and disorders.”

The acquisition is expected to be completed in the first half of 2026. Under the agreement, Lilly will acquire all outstanding shares in Ventyx, making up around 10% of Ventyx’ outstanding stock.

The acquisition of Ventyx builds on Lilly’s existing research and development programmes in autoimmune and inflammatory disease.

name: Publicis Groupe
title: Adobe expands GenStudio with new AI tools and ad integrations | CPK Stock News
authors: Stock Titan Editorial Team, Stock Titan
description:
Adobe GenStudio for Performance Marketing.
Delivering proprietary and on-brand generative AI models Adobe Firefly Foundry enables businesses to work directly with Adobe and create tailored generative AI models that are unique to their brand.
Trained on entire catalogs of existing IP, these proprietary Adobe Firefly Foundry models are deeply tuned and can be built on top of commercially safe Adobe Firefly models.
Adobe and the Adobe logo are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Adobe in the United States and/or other countries.
View source version on businesswire.com: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20251028451597/en/ Public relations contact Kevin Fu Adobe kfu@adobe.com Source: Adobe
text:
Chesapeake Utilities Corporation Promotes Michael Cassel to Senior Vice President, Strategic Development

01/08/2026 - 08:25 AM

New AI-powered capabilities across GenStudio offerings—including GenStudio for Performance Marketing, Firefly Design Intelligence and Firefly Creative Production for Enterprise—simplifies the process of scaling on-brand and personalized content.

Adobe Firefly Foundry provides businesses with private, deeply-tuned AI models across image, video, audio, vector and 3D—securely trained on their proprietary, branded content.

Integrations with advertising partners including Amazon Ads, Google Marketing Platform, Innovid, LinkedIn and TikTok make it seamless for creatives and marketers to activate or optimize display and video ad campaigns.

LOS ANGELES--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Today, at Adobe MAX – the world’s largest creativity conference – Adobe (Nasdaq:ADBE) announced major innovations in GenStudio, its integrated solution that enables businesses to power their content supply chain with the latest advancements in AI. GenStudio simplifies one of the most pressing challenges facing creative and marketing teams today, where an insatiable demand for content is outpacing organizational resources. Adobe is addressing this by extending generative AI and AI agents directly into content production workflows, working directly with businesses to create tailored generative AI models, and streamlining experience delivery via integrations with Amazon Ads, Google Marketing Platform, Innovid, LinkedIn and TikTok.

Adobe GenStudio for Performance Marketing.

“GenStudio brings together best-in-class Adobe capabilities for businesses to remain competitive in an attention-based economy, dramatically shortening the time it takes to deliver on-brand experiences at scale,” said Varun Parmar, general manager, Adobe GenStudio and Firefly Enterprise. “Adobe is the technology partner of choice for global businesses because of our deep expertise in bringing together AI, creativity and marketing workflows, providing a unified platform where teams can assemble, activate and optimize content for any channel—all in one place.”

Today, 99% of Fortune 100 companies have used AI in an Adobe app, and nearly 90% of the Top 50 enterprise accounts have adopted one or more of Adobe’s AI-first innovations including GenStudio offerings such as GenStudio for Performance Marketing and Firefly Services. Brands including The Coca-Cola Company, dentsu, The Estée Lauder Companies, Henkel, IBM, IPG Health, Lumen Technologies, Monks, The National Football League, Newell Brands, PepsiCo/Gatorade, Prudential Financial, Publicis Groupe, Qualcomm, Stagwell and Tapestry have been working with Adobe AI-powered offerings such as Firefly and GenStudio to shorten the time it takes to launch campaigns and engage new audiences—activating generative AI and agents to streamline workflows and boost creative output.

New innovations in Adobe GenStudio include:

Scaling and streamlining on-brand content production

Firefly Design Intelligence is a new AI-powered tool for businesses to scale brand and design-compliant content globally. Inspired by a collaboration with The Coca Cola Company, it moves teams beyond static brand guidelines by training “StyleIDs”—design systems that codify complex design and visual identity rules—for use in Creative Cloud apps to generate new layouts and copy, select assets, and arrange components into polished designs.

Firefly Creative Production for Enterprise expands the web app for quickly resizing and reframing thousands of assets. New enterprise-grade capabilities include a workflow builder for creating reusable production workflows, integrations with Adobe Experience Manager Assets and Frame.io to streamline asset importing and exporting, and over 20 generative and creative actions including object compositing and brand checks.

Adobe’s Content Production Agent is now available in beta in GenStudio for Performance Marketing, a generative AI-first app for scaling on-brand ads, emails and more. The agent interprets marketing briefs and automatically produces relevant content for different channels, while aligning with campaign goals and brand guidelines.

Adobe Firefly Services APIs enable businesses to automate and accelerate creative workflows at scale. New offerings now support video reframing and object compositing, while the new Content Authenticity API (beta) embeds verifiable digital credentials at scale to protect brand integrity.

Firefly Custom Models enable businesses to train Firefly on select images to create customized, brand consistent content for select marketing use cases. Integration with Firefly Boards now drives visually consistent and on-brand ideation, while new self-serve enhancements make it easier for teams to adopt and use Custom Models.

Delivering proprietary and on-brand generative AI models

Adobe Firefly Foundry enables businesses to work directly with Adobe and create tailored generative AI models that are unique to their brand. Trained on entire catalogs of existing IP, these proprietary Adobe Firefly Foundry models are deeply tuned and can be built on top of commercially safe Adobe Firefly models. This unlocks the value of AI, helping teams scale on-brand content production, create new customer experiences and extend their IP. With Firefly as the anchor, Adobe Firefly Foundry models can support all major asset types including image, video, audio, vector and 3D—accelerating content delivery for brand campaigns, performance marketing, media production workflows and more.

Activating and optimizing campaigns across ad partners

In GenStudio for Performance Marketing, teams can now automatically assemble, activate and optimize experiences across a variety of major advertising platforms. Expanded partnerships and integrations that are available now include:

Amazon Ads: Activate display ads directly with Amazon Ads (Generally available)

Innovid: Activate and measure display ad campaigns, with performance insights to optimize creative and drive better engagement (Available in beta)

Google: Activate video ads directly with Google Campaign Manager 360 in Google Marketing Platform (Coming soon in beta)

LinkedIn: Export video and image ads directly to LinkedIn Campaign Manager, and use LinkedIn performance data to optimize creative assets (Generally available)

TikTok: Create image and video ads, activate them directly across the platform, and access performance insights (Available in beta)

About Adobe

Adobe is changing the world through digital experiences. For more information, visit www.adobe.com.

© 2025 Adobe. All rights reserved. Adobe and the Adobe logo are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Adobe in the United States and/or other countries. All other trademarks are the property of their respective owners.

Kevin Fu

Adobe

kfu@adobe.com
